reviews.review_msg: No Comments
No Comments

Prof. Kropinski is excellent. She is very caring and when you will look back you will understand how well the course was taught. She went out of her way to show us a neat technique of dimensional analysis (which is not required to be taught), which has stuck with me ever since.
Exams are fair and quite similar to the previous ones. Lectures are informative and amazing. She's there to help you if you come to her office hours. Would take other courses with her.

She teaches the material at a suitable pace for people who are new to the topic. Examples are insightful and she explains them well. I think people would have a better impression of her if she acts a little happier about what she's doing. (I understand it's hard sometimes, but just a comment)

She is a very good lecturer, as she goes through material in constant rate giving you all you need to know for homework and exams. She is clear and concise, which is very important in Math classes. Love her loud voice: no need for a microphone at all. Pretty good organization of notes and clear writing.
Bad, bad professor. I wonder how she got her doctoral degree.. she makes a billion mistakes in her ill-prepared lectures.
his lecture is clear and straightforward.

Made exams quite easy relative to previous professors (particularly with respect to the practice MT and final).  Incredibly straightforward lectures to understand and approachable too if you have any questions.  An excellent choice for the course.

Justin's first time teaching this course. His lecture slides help a lot in summarizing the main concepts of the course, also the examples that he provides during lectures.  He is very clear when it comes to teaching the material, would recommend if you are taking math 310!

The lecture notes are very useful and are easy to read. He's a nice guy, and can clearly explain the topics, even for the first time teaching the course! Seems to be very approachable, as well. Would recommend taking a course with him.

great prof. makes concepts easy and a very fair marker, lenient, and hilarious. Best math class, and vijay makes the class interesting and he has your attention all class. Exams and quizzes were straightforward.
Midterms were very fair and the final was much harder. There's a lot to learn in this class. This class was more difficult then Calc 3 for me.

Amazing, hilarious, respectful and approachable professor. You can tell he genuinely cares about the students and wants everyone to exceed. There are no surprises on the midterm and he told us exactly what to expect. Lectures are not mandatory and completed posted notes are uploaded. Highly recommend you take this professor!
low class average on midterm and final (both below 50%), no assignment solutions
Beside James, this is the second best prof I had ever at SFU. His math notes are the best.
Good prof.Midterms and finals are long, and there is hardly any space to write your answer in. Also the TA's and him didn't keep their office hours too well

Great prof. Got asked lots of questions during class and was NEVER stumped or confused, always helpful. Very good at one-on-one explanations during office hours, and has extremely clear and useful fill-in-the-blanks style notes so you can pay attention more. He writes VERY long exams, however, so be prepared to work REALLY FAST.
He is the greatest prof in  math department!!!! know his stuff, and reeaaaally care about students. you just learn a lot from him!definitely recommended!

I took both 310 and 251 with Ralf this semester and quite enjoyed his lectures. He has very organized notes and well-rounded explanations. He gave a lot of exercises to help you understand materials. He was also very reachable. The only downside was he posted homework/sample exams so late. I was quite annoyed. But other than that, I recommend him!

He's an okay prof. He is very repetitive in lectures and goes over one too many example. I stopped taking notes about a month in. The assignments were long and some of the questions were really weird. But his exams are fair but you will be pressed for time on midterms.
His marking is awful! His exams are long and too much writting. I don't know what is this guy looking to prove?
best math prof i've had. well prepared, very useful and clear notes, readily helps students outside of class. come away actually understanding the material, and knowing it well.

Ralf is very nice, helpful and approachable. If you have any difficulties, just go see him. I would not have passed this course without his extra help. He gives out bonus marks on every homework and exam. His final is quite challenging, but it is doable if you pay attention in class.

Great prof.  Assignments were very long, but midterms and final were EXTREMELY easy, and everyone ended up with a great mark.  If you want to actually put in a bit of work, take a class with him, but if you want to slack off all semester and whine about it after than his classes aren't for you.

Comes across as condescending and is difficult to approach. Expects very detailed solutions to problems and makes extremely long assignments. Average for this course was a C, which is the lowest average I've ever seen. Would highly recommend avoiding this prof, you'll put in more work and effort into this course but come out with a lower mark

John's lectures are amazing! They are the reason I pull my ass out of my bed every morning. He really understands the topic and is passionate about teaching it. He also goes through many applications which is always interesting.

Wouldn't recommend this prof to anyone. He doesn't scale for this course which is crazy considering it's a 300 lvl course and his assignments are brutal to complete. He's not that easy to approach to because he sounds really condescending when he talks to you but that's just my opinion. Either way if he's the prof for 310 just straight up avoid him

A very difficult professor.  His assignments are very very long (20+ pages) and contain very little material, are very mechanical.  Make sure you've taken MATH 232 and MATH 251.  Lectures, Midterm solutions, and Assignment solutions are riddled with errors.  You will get few to no part marks on the midterm, or finals exams.

Textbook by Boyce isn't very good. Stockie doesn't scale his class at all. While you should not necessarily need scaling, it puts you at a disadvantage compared to if you were to take the course with someone else, regardless of how well you do. I wouldn't recommend him on this alone.

Fair midterm, 6 well spaced assignments. This is a mechanics/formula's course, so practice and study will be your friend. Good explanations during lecture, but has little patience for questions not directly related to the course material.

has little patience answering poorly stated questions, gets irritated by them. interesting lectures though, his explanations are clear, most times. only 6 assignments and 1 midterm. midterm was all right, but he likes MC questions which can be tricky and easy to lose marks on. I would take another class with him.

Very helpful prof with very realistic expectations for his students. The midterm was very straightforward and is not about a bunch of tricks or gimmicks. The work load is just right, 6 assignments in total and no other projects. The material can get a little dry a times but that happens to almost every subject.

Awesome prof! Very clear and gives incredibly reasonable tests. Not easy, but definitely fair. I've read the tests from other profs, and they're just a bunch of tricks. Not Stockie's. His lectures are also very interesting. Take this course with Stockie. One word of warning though, he's a total jerk to people who ask the wrong questions.
I strongly recommend avoiding any course taught by him.
Easy and pleasant class. Very organized and professional guy. Notes are useful enough to not need to read the textbook. Homework and exams are closely related and similar in difficulty.

Great prof, very comprehensive and decently easy to follow lectures. Exam and quizzes were very fair and based on the homework. He's a passionate brit and will take every opportunity to talk about how Britain is superior, which is pretty entertaining. He is on the stern side of things, and doesn't like it when you don't pay attention in lecture
He sounds condescending, but in truth he's a nice dude and he cares if you can show you care about the material too
U can sleep in his lecture and by doing homework, u can get an A.

The result of SFU's budget cuts. Talks to his page which he projects onto the screen all class long and occasionally looks up every 20 minutes to check if his muddled speech has put students to sleep. Skip Joe's classes and just watch MIT's amazing Arthur Mattuck in 18.03 (Spring 2006). Explains clearly, in depth, and in fewer/shorter lectures.

Joe is an amazing prof! He's very clear on his explanations and gave a fair midterm and final! He tells you what you're going to be tested on exactly and the types of questions! Would definitely take again and I recommend anyone to take this class with him!

Confusing lectures. He copies off the textbook and just reads off it during class. Unfortunately, the textbook often likes to assume things are obvious (usually its not), and he does not provide any further explanation during class.  Also, He talks very very fast, which makes his heavy accent even more difficult to understand.

Absolutely USELESS lectures. This is how I learn for this class: I watch youtube vids to learn the material, come to class and sit near the back doing the homework during Monday and Wednesday lectures, come on Fridays 5min before the quiz to write it and leave. Thank you Khan Academy, Patrick JMT and IntegralCALC for the USEFUL lectures.
never. just never. The thing that he is doing in class can never define as teach and the system does not let me rate 0

Your best bet is to form a study group and teach each other, because this prof is exceptionally useless in lectures.   Teaming up with a group and a Chegg account is probably the best way to get through this!
He has a bad accent and unorganized notes. Cannot see what he is doing in class. Worst prof I have ever had.

This may sound rude but he is the absolute worst prof I have had to date. Not only is it next to impossible to understand him, but the notes are so confusing and disorganized that you might as read the back of a cereal box for help. If you have this class with him, drop it so you don't waste your money.

I have never encountered lectures that were as useless as the ones Joe gives. He essentially reads scribbled notes on a lined piece of paper which are not legible to anybody but Joe himself. Lectures are pointless, your best bet is to learn by yourself. Run far away from this class, not sure why this is even allowed to exist as a class.
horrible accent and can't teach. If you take this course, you'd better RUN!
A great professor!

This guy is amazing , Lectures are the key to the exams, Midterm was easy but final a little bit tricky! Although I didn't get an A in Math 310 but I'm sure that he scaled at least 2 letter grades. Just take any courses with him and boost up you GPA..

Always a pleasure to attend his classes. lectures are clear and grasp the essence of course materials. great attitude towards students. exams are straight forward if you know what you are doing. need more?

Math 310 is definitely a hard course but Steve makes it easier than what other people say about math 310. Steve is on time, prepared and clear. His assignments are a little bit hard but still doable and fair, however, his midterm is very easy and straigh forward. His final is harder than midterm or it is just tricker. Overal he is a good proff.

Took Intro to Differential Equations with Cameron in Fall 2014. I enjoyed his class because he wasn't one of those profs who reads from the textbook. His examples were good and his assignments tested your understanding. His flaw: he tends to get confused during some of his explanations. Don't bother with the textbook - use Paul's Online Math Notes.
Unfortunately, he is terrible. Terrible   useless, not valuable, unclear. Still, he seems to be a nice guy.
Truly one of the few amazing professors at SFU. MATH 310 doesn't exist as a class anymore but try to get her with any other courses she teaches.

This is the second time I took Brenda's course and I got to talk to her more. She is responsible and REALLY NICE, and sometimes humorous during the lecture. She would stay after the lecture so we could ask her questions on time. Also, she held fairly enough office hours and welcomed us go ask questions at any time. Strongly recommend her!!!!!!!

She is one of the best prof I have ever taken a course with. The course is challenging but Brenda encourages student tremendously. Especially, she tells a joke every mid-time of class to make sure the class is not boring and more interactive. Really recommended if you're looking for a prof to push you beyond your limit.
this guy sucks! misses stuff that the course is suppose to offer, and his attitude stinks!
I love the way he moves and walks around in class -- he is so sexy.  If he were a girl I would definitely want to date him.
this guy should tape himself and sell the tape to people who can't sleep. He'll make a fortune!!!!!!
Boring.
don't explain well, make stuff more confusing than it is, rude to students
Highly recommend. He knows how to teach and he makes it interesting. Be careful, he asks quit lot of 'must understand' questions, definitions, theorems, etc...
This guy is awesome

His test were very well written. Good evaluations. He appears to love being a prof, there is euphoria behind his eyes when he goes up to teach. It's kinda great. He can be unclear if you zone out for a bit, then come back to it (lullaby voice). I found him to be my best professor of the semester (not a great selection though).
like this prof
*couldn't understand his accent. *make lots of mistakes during lecture. *TA was more helpful than prof..
cant understand his accent. no one attends lecture because of it
this guy doesn't want to scale the grades

Dr. Drakes is the most clear, straight-forward math professor at SFU.  She is very receptive to questions, and her notes are really good.  Apparently she offends some people; I think they need to lighten up.  Her exams are difficult but fair; she asks theory questions as well as math problems (you have to use words AND numbers)
In my opinion, Dr. Drakes is a rude, tactless person. She is an ordinary instructor, definitely better than an average one, but I had no pleasure to return to the classroom.
though she went back, she is a joker more than a teacher. her class is recommended for students with joke major ONLY
Great teacher, but has extremely high expectations of students - very, very very difficult exams, homework and quizzes.

Chiaka is awesome. Her notes are concise and her lectures are lively. She will keep you awake with her humour and will encourage questions after every concept she explains. If you do the homework and follow her instructions, the exams will not be that hard. If you walk into the exam unprepared thinking you will do okay, you're gonna have a bad time
Hard final, the hardest I've ever seen

An energetic prof who gives very helpful notes. She tries to encourage questions, keeps office hours, and promotes interest. The exams are VERY difficult; the "memory sheet" is virtually useless for the theorems she tests (nearly exact wording required). Also, her homework assignments are good practice, but quite lengthy.
Nice lecturs, but Exams are so hard!!

She's very energetic and interesting to listen to, which, for a math professor, is a huge bonus. She's helpful, and encourages questions, but I find her explanations too 'mathy' for my tastes; she doesn't relate the material to the outside world or give good analogies so that you have a better understanding. Her midterm and final are brutally hard.
I don't like her at all !! she is funny and nice, however her class is too hard. she likes to put some tricky problems in the exams and overall her exams is too hard !!!!

She is a good professor, the midterm was a bit of a loose cannon and nobody expected the format that was given. However she basically has allowed everyone to redeem themselves for the final which is nice. Enthusiastic prof, encourages questions and participation in class!

Sfu is lucky to have her to teach math. She is really one if the best math prof I have seen in my life. She makes math so much more interesting. Very enthusiastic about math. Super engaging in class and in office hour. She says "if you are not good at math at all, drop this course" so expect to put in more efforts if you want to do good in class
hard to understand
Dr. Masood is obviously enthusiastic but lack of experience. Also, he needs to improve his pronunciation.

Great prof! At first she seems quite scary and slightly rude, but once you get to know her you realize she is the complete opposite. She really cares about her students. She provides worksheets to do with the solutions. If you look over lecture notes, do the worksheets, do the tutorial problems, then nothing on the midterms will be a surprise.
Exams are very tough, expects everyone to know everything, go to her classes and take notes! practise all the sample questions and tutorial questions or else you will suffer!
He is very awsome and friendly, his lecture notes are well coordinated. The tutorials are helpful and his exams are so-so.

It was my best luck ever to do the course with professor Jungic. He has the real insight into material and readily shares it with you. Always helps and inspires. I fell in love with Math because he shown me its beauty.

Assignments are time comsuming but not really hard. His midterms are easy since sample midterms are given. However, the final is killer. KNOWING HOW TO DISTINGUISH AND SOLVE DIFFERENT KINDS OF EQUATION IS ESSENTIAL!!!
Very Easy Exams
He knows what he is doing. Classes are interesting .His assignments are long (really long). Midterms and finals are fair. He does not scale. Great prof overall.

Extremely knowledgeable and passionate about Math. His enthusiasm is infectious. His tests are extremely fair and definitely related to his hw. Attend his lectures, do his hw, and your efforts will be rewarded. Definitely recommend.
worst prof in this whole universe

One of the best math profs at SFU. His lectures are great. As long as you study for the exams, you'll do fine.
 Sometimes Jungic is hilarious eg "The thing with math is... You never really understand it. You just get used to it."
 =D
One of the best profs I have ever had. He knows students by name in a class of over 100. Very approachable and a genuinely nice guy. Use his practice exams to prepare for the midterms and final.
